title: section 11 of the Social Welfare (Covid-19) (Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 13) (Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) (amendment) (no 13) (covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment) regulation 2021 (2) regulation social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) regulation 2007 2021 shall construed together one may cited together social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) regulation 2007 2021

title: section 11 of the Social Welfare (Covid-19) (Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of
heading: 2. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
2. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
Regulations 2007 are amended by the insertion of the following article after 
article 52K: 

“Date on which applications for the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment 
payment shall cease. 

52L. For the purposes of section 68N(2)(a), the 8th day of July 2021 is 
prescribed as the date on which applications for Covid-19 pandemic 
unemployment payment shall cease.”. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th July, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [332] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 July, 2021. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 July, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [332]

title: section 11 of the Social Welfare (Covid-19) (Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations specify 8th July 2021 as the date when applications for 
Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment shall cease. This means that the 
last date on which applications for the payment will be accepted is 7th July
text_norm: explanatory note (this note part instrument purport legal interpretation.) regulation specify 8th july 2021 date application covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment shall cease mean last date application payment accepted 7th july
